Description of incident: Sutter Health has notified patients/customers of a data breach when they discovered that a former employee had emailed documents of individuals to a personal email address on April 26, 2013.The information in these electronic documents included names, dates of birth, insurance identification numbers, dates of services and billing codes. They have stated that no Social Security numbers, drivers' license or ID numbers, credit card or bank information was contained in these documents. Sutter Health is offering one year free of Experian's ProtectMyID Alert for those who were affected. Those with questions call 1-877-235-0796 Monday through Friday, 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Pacific Time. More Information: http://oag.ca.gov/ecrime/databreach/reports/sb24-57764
